ratings.comment:
Ewa is the best language teacher I've had—demanding, often cold-calling students, and not for everyone. But her well-designed course and high standards ensure you learn a lot if you stick with it.
A special focus is on grammar which many students struggle with. A lot of opportunities to practice grammar, speaking, writing and listening.

She is so so so mean. Like, outwardly, in class, in front of all your peers. It happened to me, it happened to countless others. It's embarrassing. I regret not just taking the M/W/F class. She's not even worth a T/Th.

I have a love/hate relationship with this class. Grading is very harsh, and she is not particularly forgiving of mistakes. She's a cold-caller and the class might damage your self-esteem. That being said, this was also some of the highest quality education I've ever had. The class is well-taught, but is not for the faint of heart.
As said in other reviews, there are a ton of awesome UW French professors, but Ewa is not one of them. I don't think being so harsh is the best way to get kids to learn French.

While my French did improve, Ewa did her best to make this the least enjoyable French class of my life. The intimidation made me less willing to speak as compared to the other AMAZING and KIND professors in the UW French department.
Ewa is a great teacher, but be ready to work. She gives out a lot of homework each week and you actually have to put in a lot of time. She is a cold caller, which makes class not super enjoyable.

Ewa truly cares about learning. She will cold call on you, give repeated feedback, and make hard exams. But she does this because she WANTS students to learn and succeed. That being said, the course is hard, and you must be prepared for this if you choose to take it. It helps if you are passionate about the language.

This is my 2nd class with Ewa & I love her. She can be intimidating & very direct, but this honestly pushes students to work hard to improve their french. She cares about her students & wants them to do well so she constantly enforces students to go to office hrs. Highly reccomend her class if you want to improve your french & will put in the work.

Miernowska gives a lot of homework but it's what you should expect for a 3 credit class. She does tell you very clearly what she expects from you so if you don't do the hw/participate, she will call you out. Overall she was a good professor and I can tell my french reading and writing skills have improved dramatically because of her class.

Miernowska gives daily homework, which can be a lot at first. But her assignments are fair and really help you improve your reading/writing skills. She runs class very efficiently and is excellent at explaining grammatical concepts, as well as leading discussions on more substantive cultural issues. I definitely improved my French in her class.

Ewa is a TOUGH grader. Homework is not completion, it's correctness. Exams are rough, she is a PICKY professor to please. SO MUCH HOMEWORK, 2-3 hours per class session. Participation is mandatory and she's aggressive and upfront if you don't. Ultimately, her goal really is to see students succeed but her methods are abrasive. Prepare yourself.

Ewa is a tough but enthusiastic instructor, and I learned a lot in her class. This class is surely not an easy A. She will cold call almost every class and call you out for not being prepared. The homeworks and exams are also not easy, but if you put in the time, you will receive a good grade and learn a good amount of French.

The best language class I have ever taken (and i have taken a lot of them in different countries). You will spend about 2 hours a day for homework, but the results are amazing and you can see your progress clearly by the end of the semester. Pani Ewa can be at times intimidating for American students: just take it as a cultural component

If you are taking Ewa's French class to get retro credits, get an easy A, etc. DON'T. Madame Miernowska is very strict on grading, cares about your participation, and can give lots of homework some nights. If you are a French major and are willing to spend a lot of time in French, DO take her class. She is a caring person and will help with homewor

Madame Miernowska is tough, but this class has been more useful to me than most of my previous French classes. Preparation, attendance, and participation are crucial to being successful. She often calls on people randomly so make sure to understand the day's reading(s). Her class is a great experience if you're willing to put in the work.

I had Ewa for French 228, and it WAS AWFUL. We had endless amount of homework that counts for a large portion of your grade. There's a great amount of other work, which is SO time consuming. Ewa is very serious. If you miss her class, you won't pass, and she takes it personally if you miss.  She can sometimes treat you like you're stupid, too.

Pani Ewa is an extremely effective language teacher. It's a LOT of work and you can't half-ass it--but put in the time & you'll be fine. Has an issue with taking every mistake or misstep VERY personally, which can lead to her being inappropriately rude when one on one, or at least lead to snippy comments in class. Stay on her good side. Seriously.

If you are trying to learn Polish with little to no background, SHE IS NOT HELPFUL. She expects all students to be on the same level, even though native speakers were mixed in with beginners. She is spiteful and takes bad grades/non-attendance personally and does not give leniency towards family problems, personal problems, etc. Wish I never took.

She is VERY intense. She piles on too much homework and expects you to put all of your time and effort into this one class! For a gen ed this class is ridiculous. The workload is overwhelming and the readings are difficult to understand especially for non polish students. She knows how to teach and she's helpful but she just expects way too much

Ewa speaks quickly with a slight (and I mean minuscule) Polish accent, which takes some getting used to. Despite her high expectations, she has been my favorite French professor thus far at UW. You'll learn so much, from grammar and pronunciation to acute literary analysis and cultural study. She has great insight to share and makes class lively.

If you ever have a chance to take a class with Ewa do it! She is awesome! At first she may seem tough but if you try hard in her class, she will like you. I learned so much more in this class than I ever have in any other French class.  She also talks about interesting current events and French culture vs. just sticking to the books.
Pani Ewa expects a lot and demands respect, but she's a very likable woman and you learn so much. This class was by far my favorite of the semester.
She's really intense and class is incredibly fast paced. But if you do your homework and come to class prepared, you'll be fine!

Absolute worst professor I've ever had.  She is spiteful. She is not understanding and will criticize you for not being a literary expert even for those who have no prior experience and expects you to come in knowing everything (not a teacher mentality). I had family problems all semester and she said I deserved to fail because I was making it up
One of the most passionate teachers I have seen in my life. Makes learning so much more fun! She will make you work extremely hard but you will learn more than you believed possible in one semester.

So mean! So so mean!! She's very nice as a person, but very strict in class and will make you feel highly inadequate if you don't consistently do your work. Definitely the hardest grader I've had for French. Grades essays, tests, AND HOMEWORK heavilyyy on grammar, unlike the other teachers who care more about whether you absorbed the content well.

She's kind of intense at first and things might seem overwhelming but everything calms down after a few weeks. You MUST know your grammar otherwise you're screwed for essays! She'll pick on people so  do the readings! otherwise, great teacher and overall a fun class!

Pros: you will be challenged, and if you do the reading, you're able to participate. (Participation/attendance = 30% of grade) Cons: If she doesn't like you or calls on you and you don't have an answer... beware. VERY tough grader on TESTS. Grammar = KEY! Challenging, but sometimes is overboard.
She is very strict but if you do the homework and participate you'll do fine. Her grading is really tough and it takes some getting used to. Lots of reading but never anything too difficult

As a freshman, I had no transition from high school to college with her.. But she's wonderful. She reminds me of one of my Polish aunts. I adore her and love the class, because it reminds me of home. Definitely taking as many semesters with her as possible.
Very hard class, moves quickly and homework is graded on accuracy, but other than that you are guaranteed to learn polish. She knows what she is doing.

Great teacher. Very passionate about her work, does her best to help you understand material. Expects you to put in an effort, and rewards you for doing so. Tells you exactly what is expected and you learn a lot, but its totally interesting. One of my favorite teachers on campus. Would recommend her to anyone who wants to learn the language.
Previously majored in French, came back for a refresher.  Much tougher than the professors at my undergrad, but very passionate about the subject.

Pani Ewa is one of the strictest teachers I've ever had. That being said, she is very happy and always making little jokes in class, and is an excellent teacher. I've learned more from her than any other language teacher I've ever had.

I learned more polish in 1 semester than I did french in 5 years before college. She teaches you the language very effectively, but expect to work a lot at it. I was in ochem and biocore at the same time as this, and I worked more on polish than the other two put together. intense but worth it

She is the best teacher I have ever had. Everything everyone has said is very true. If you want to learn polish quickly and very well take the honors intensive intro I have taken 5 years of spanish and i speak it very well, after one semester with Professor Miernowska i would say i speak Polish just as well as Spanish.

First and foremost: intimidating.  Work hard and respect her and you'll be fine.  Be a smart ass or show up late - you will be chewed out.  Despite how scared I was sometimes...I never missed class, worked extremely hard, and learned so much.  She did what a teacher is supposed to do - make you significantly better.

She is my favorite professor on campus. At first she's pretty intimidating because she makes you come out of your comfort zone to speak French. However, over the course of the semesteryou grow to be really comfortable with her; she's super personable and she knows her stuff! Also, you get so much better at French.
She is amazing!  I was really intimidated when i first had her for 271 but you will learn so much.  She's demanding and very honest, which sometimes is necessary to do your best :)
Improved alot

Cares very much about her students.  Notice that she already a prof of French so I believe she teaches Polish out of passion and maybe patriotic duty.  She bases your grade on your individual improvement, so if you put in hard work you'll earn a good grade.  Small class size.  Highly recommended.

My favorite professor at the university thus far. She's very energetic and really pushes you to learn the material. She's blunt, but don't be offended - it's just her way of pushing you. Be prepared to work, but learn a great deal as well.
Miernowska was a very difficult teacher and gives out extreme amounts of homework. I enjoyed French until I had her as a professor. I feel like I learned more in 204 with a TA who was nice.
She is awesome; she makes class fun, she really pushes you to learn the material, and she teaches with passion.

Intimidating professor, expects lots, really pushes you but at the end of the semester, I spoke French very well; gives lots of HW but works very hard to hand back ASAP; good prof overall but be ready for lots of work, usually spent 3-5 hrs on HW; your French will improve lots with her due to the constantly talking+HW.
The best teacher I have had--in any country. If you want to speak Polish in one year, take her class!
